p: There is another group of phenolic compounds in extracts of this species; the main one is rosmarinic acid (RA). That is why the use of S. khuzistanica has become important in recent years in medicine and pharmacology research. RA belongs to the group of polyphenols which is found most notably in many Lamiaceae plants, and has antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and antimicrobial activities. RA helps to prevent cell damage caused by free radicals, thereby reducing the risk of cancer and atherosclerosis.
